Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers secured a 41-point lead in the first half with a score of 83-42.
Steph Curry was held down to 12 points and 25% accuracy from beyond the arc.
Buddy Hield held down to three points and only made one basket the entire night.
Jonathan Kuminga had a great game, putting up 21 points, six rebounds, and five assists.
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors hoped to carry on their momentum to beat the Cavs' undefeated 9-0 streak.
Cleveland Cavaliers did a good job stopping the Golden State Warriors' main scorers as Curry, Buddy Hield, and Andrew Wiggins all struggled to gain momentum.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland Cavaliers won with a 136-117 finish, extending their undefeated season to 10-0.
Golden State Warriors suffered their second defeat of the season but still showed resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers dominated the Warriors in the first half, setting a high bar for the rest of the game.
Jonathan Kuminga had a standout performance despite his teammates struggling.
